input_data.title: Mr Selfridge
input_data.overview: Mr. Selfridge recounts the real life story of the flamboyant and visionary American founder of Selfridge's, London's lavish department store. Set in 1909 London, when women were reveling in a new sense of freedom and modernity, it follows Harry Gordon Selfridge ('Mile a Minute Harry'), a man with a mission to make shopping as thrilling as sex. Pioneering and reckless, with an almost manic energy, Harry created a theater of retail where any topic or trend that was new, exciting, entertaining - or just eccentric - was showcased.

response.analytical_summary: Mr. Selfridge is a historical drama series that chronicles the founding and early years of the iconic London department store, Selfridge's. The show explores themes of ambition, social change, and the burgeoning consumer culture of the early 20th century. It blends elements of a family saga with a business narrative, portraying the personal lives of Harry Selfridge and those around him against the backdrop of a rapidly evolving society. The series offers a glimpse into a pivotal moment in history, showcasing the rise of modern retail and its impact on London's social fabric, all while maintaining a focus on the complexities of human relationships and the pursuit of dreams.
response.spoiler_rich_plot_summary: The series begins with Harry Gordon Selfridge's arrival in London and his ambitious plan to establish a grand department store, unlike anything seen before. He assembles a team, including the pragmatic Frank Digby and the charming John Harding, to help realize his vision. The early seasons focus on the store's establishment and its initial struggles, interwoven with the personal lives of the main characters. Harry's personal life is complicated by his marriage to Adele, who battles with mental health issues, and his relationships with various women. As the store gains popularity, it becomes a microcosm of London society, reflecting the changing roles of women, the rise of the middle class, and the tensions of the pre-war era. Later seasons explore the impact of World War I on the store and its employees, leading to significant changes in the characters' lives and the business itself. The series culminates in a portrayal of the store's resilience and its enduring legacy, though not without acknowledging the personal sacrifices and losses endured along the way.
response.keyword_sentence: Mr. Selfridge portrays a dramatic and nostalgic journey through early 20th-century London, exploring themes of ambition, social change, and romantic relationships within the bustling environment of a burgeoning department store empire.
